wikipedia_page.main: Walter Arthur Copinger  (14 April 1847 – 13 March 1910) was an English professor of law, antiquary and bibliographer.

response: *Walter Arthur Copinger, lawyer and scholar, lived in Greenheys

Largely owing to the efforts of Walter Arthur Copinger, who was supported by Richard Copley Christie, the Bibliographical Society was founded in London in 1892; he was the society's first president, and held the post for four years. His own work in the field, however, lacked accuracy.
*Walter Arthur Copinger (1847-1910), English lawyer & author, hymn writer, co-founder of the Bibliographical Society, London, and Angel in the Catholic Apostolic Church

A 1648 work Epistola ad Spanheimum, in the controversy over universal grace and Amyraldism,Amyraldianism, in Edwin Hartshorn Palmer (editor), The Encyclopedia of Christianity, Volume 1, p. 188; PDF. was answered by Friedrich Spanheim in Epistola ad Cottierum (1648).Walter Arthur Copinger, A Treatise on Predestination, Election and Grace, Historical, Doctrinal, and Practical; to which is added a bibliography of the subject (1889), p. lxxv; archive.org.

He compiled a bibliography of all the incunabula in the US and purchased a number of rare books for the library, including Walter Arthur Copinger's collection of 500 incunabula and fourteen Portuguese antiphonaries given to the College of Saint Jerome by King John III.
